Legal_Issue: Whether the immigration officer erred in law by failing to distinguish between humanitarian and compassionate considerations and pre-removal risk assessments
Decision_Outcome: Remanded for proper evaluation under section 25 of IRPA
Legal_Rule: Section 25 of IRPA allows for humanitarian and compassionate considerations; sections 97, 112, and 113 address pre-removal risk assessments
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness or correctness (implied by judicial review context)
Procedural_Issue: Conflation of humanitarian and compassionate considerations with pre-removal risk assessment
Grounds_for_Claim: Risk upon return to Hungary, family circumstances
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Officer closed her mind to necessary considerations
Key_Evidence_Considered: Family circumstances, risk factors, refugee claim details
Applicant_Challenge: Failure to properly assess humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Remedy_Sought: Proper assessment under section 25 of IRPA
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Perceived lack of risk upon return to Hungary
Applicable_Process: Humanitarian and compassionate application process, pre-removal risk assessment
Pending_Relief_or_Application: Application under section 25 of IRPA pending reassessment
Governing_Rule: Distinction between humanitarian and compassionate considerations and pre-removal risk assessments under IRPA
